metadata.job_to_be_done: Create and manage fillable forms for onboarding and compliance.

extracted_sections.section_title: Change flat forms to fillable (Acrobat Pro)

subsection_analysis.refined_text:
Sometimes form creators don’t convert their PDFs to 
interactive fillable forms. Fill in PDF Forms 
 
Is the form fillable. Not all forms are fillable. Fill in interactive forms 
An interactive form contains fields that you can select or fill in. These non-interactive forms are called flat forms.

Change flat forms to fillable (Acrobat Pro) 
You can change a flat form to a fillable form by either using the Prepare Form tool or 
enabling the Fill & Sign tools. Interactive form 
To create an interactive form, use the Prepare Forms tool. When you create a different form, redo this 
task to enable Acrobat Reader users to use the tools. Acrobat and Acrobat Reader users can use the Fill & Sign tool 
to fill in flat forms. See Create a form from an existing 
document.

Fill and Sign PDF Forms 
You can easily fill, sign, and share your documents using Acrobat's Fill & Sign tool.

Fill and sign PDF forms 
To complete and sign PDF forms, open the form in Acrobat and then select E-Sign from the 
global bar. Acrobat 
also allows you to send your completed forms to others and securely save them in Adobe 
cloud storage. Types of PDF forms  
• 
Interactive forms: These contain fields that you can select and fill in. You can complete the forms by entering information and adding your signatures. • 
Flat forms: These do not have interactive fields.

The Auto-Complete feature is off by default, so you must enable it in the forms 
preferences if you want to use it. Auto-Complete forms (interactive forms 
only) 
The Auto-Complete feature stores any entries that you type in an interactive form field. Select Remember Numerical Data if you want the Auto-Complete memory to store 
numbers that you type into forms. Note:  
The forms preferences apply to the way that the application handles open forms as you work. In the Preferences dialog, select Forms as the preference category.
